alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 11 at 9:59PM CDT until April 11 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN ATOKA COUNTY... At 958 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Blanco to 6 miles northwest of Daisy, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Daisy, Chockie and Redden. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
